intro: Pimpinella zhongdianensis, commonly known as the Zhongdian pimpinella, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, showcasing adaptations to high-altitude conditions. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white to yellowish flowers that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
